required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Restylane® for the Treatment of Tear Trough Deformity
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Evaluation of the Efficacy and Safety of Hyaluronic Acid (Restylane®) for the Treatment of Tear Trough Deformity

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to investigate the effectiveness and tolerability of Restylane® for correction of tear trough deformity, using various injection techniques.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Patients in this current trial will initially be randomized to either needle or cannula injections, or no treatment (control; ratio 3:3:1, respectively). Subjects will proceed from randomization in parallel assignment. Subjects initially randomized to the control group at Baseline will be randomized to either needle or cannula treatment at Visit 3, Month 1 (crossover). Subjects in the crossover group will then be seen at weeks 2 and 4 post last treatment, as per Schedule 1.

primary_outcome.description: Improvement via the blinded evaluator-assessed Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (GAIS), at the one-month follow up visit. Improvement will be considered as any point-increase above 0 (no change).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of study (up to week 10)
secondary_outcome.description: Safety measurements will be evaluated by the incidence, seriousness, severity and relationship with the medical device to adverse events reported, at all visits.
